contextId.information: The implicit information can be supplied from the previous phrase. AT: "I said to you as you were lying in your blood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: I said to you in your blood

contextId.information: The missing words may be added. AT: "have oppressed people ... and plundered others" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

The phrase "same day" refers to the previous phrase "make my sanctuary unclean." AT: "and on the same day they make my sanctuary unclean, they defile my Sabbaths" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: and on the same day they defile my Sabbaths

contextId.information: The words "any sheep or goat" is left out of this phrase, but they are intended to be understood. AT: "any sheep or goats that are lost" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The words "any sheep or goat" is left out of this phrase, but they are intended to be understood. AT: "any sheep or goats that are lost" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The word "sheep" is understood. AT: "the fat sheep and the strong sheep" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
You may need to add the omitted word. AT: "Then measure the south side" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
